messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22.5 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode with medium fan speed?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The thermostat accepts a target temperature between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, and the mode can be set to Off, Heat, Cool, or Auto. Fan speed can be Low, Medium, or High. The user wants to set the target temperature to 22.5 °C, mode to Heat, and fan speed to Medium.

Step 1: Use the Set Target Temperature command with parameter 22.5 °C.
Step 2: Use the Set Mode command with parameter Heat.
Step 3: Use the Set Fan Speed command with parameter Medium.

Result: Execute STT(22.5), SM(Heat), and SFS(Medium) to fulfill the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]

USER QUERY:
What is the current temperature and mode of the thermostat?

The device properties include Current Temperature (10.0 to 30.0 °C) and Mode (Off, Heat, Cool, Auto). To obtain these values, the device supports send commands Report Temperature (RT) and Report Mode (RM).

Step 1: Send RT command to get the current temperature reading.
Step 2: Send RM command to get the current mode setting.

Result: By executing RT and RM, you will receive the current temperature and mode of the thermostat.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
          Off [0]
    Set Direction [SD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power [RP]
    Report Speed [RS]
    Report Direction [RD]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the ceiling fan, set speed to 3, and reverse the direction.

The ceiling fan has properties Power Status (Off or On), Speed Level (0 to 5), and Direction (Forward or Reverse). The user wants to turn the fan on, set speed to 3, and reverse direction.

Step 1: Use Turn On command to power the fan on.
Step 2: Use Set Speed command with parameter 3 to set the speed level.
Step 3: Use Set Direction command with parameter Reverse to change the rotation.

Result: Execute TON, SS(3), and SD(Reverse) commands to fulfill the request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
          Off [0]
    Set Direction [SD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power [RP]
    Report Speed [RS]
    Report Direction [RD]

USER QUERY:
Is the ceiling fan currently on, and what speed is it set to?

The device properties include Power Status (Off or On) and Speed Level (0 to 5). To determine the current state, the device supports send commands Report Power (RP) and Report Speed (RS).

Step 1: Send RP command to check if the fan is on or off.
Step 2: Send RS command to get the current speed level.

Result: By executing RP and RS, you will know if the fan is on and its speed setting.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Range 0.0 to 50.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Energy Usage [REU]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the water heater and set the target temperature to 60 degrees Celsius?

The water heater has properties for Current and Target Temperature (30.0 to 75.0 °C) and Power Status (On or Off). The user wants to turn it on and set the target temperature to 60 °C.

Step 1: Use Turn On command to power the water heater.
Step 2: Use Set Target Temperature command with parameter 60 °C.

Result: Execute TON and STT(60.0) commands to turn on the water heater and set the target temperature to 60 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Range 0.0 to 50.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Energy Usage [REU]

USER QUERY:
What is the current energy usage of the water heater and its current temperature?

The device properties include Energy Usage (0.0 to 50.0 kWh) and Current Temperature (30.0 to 75.0 °C). To retrieve these, the device supports send commands Report Energy Usage (REU) and Report Temperature (RT).

Step 1: Send REU command to get the current energy consumption.
Step 2: Send RT command to get the current water temperature.

Result: By executing REU and RT, you will obtain the current energy usage and temperature of the water heater.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Please open the garage door and unlock it.

The garage door device has Door Status (Closed, Open, Opening, Closing) and Lock Status (Locked, Unlocked). The user wants to open the door and unlock it.

Step 1: Use Unlock Door command to unlock the door.
Step 2: Use Open Door command to open the door.

Result: Execute UD and OD commands to unlock and open the garage door as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently closed and locked?

The device properties include Door Status (Closed, Open, Opening, Closing) and Lock Status (Locked, Unlocked). To determine the current state, the device supports send commands Report Door Status (RDS) and Report Lock Status (RLS).

Step 1: Send RDS command to check if the door is closed.
Step 2: Send RLS command to check if the door is locked.

Result: By executing RDS and RLS, you will know if the garage door is currently closed and locked.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Outdoor Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RS]
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]
    Report Schedule [RSC]

USER QUERY:
Can you enable the sprinkler schedule and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute?

The sprinkler device has properties Status (On or Off), Water Flow Rate (0.0 to 20.0 L/min), and Schedule Enabled (True or False). The user wants to enable the schedule and set flow rate to 15 L/min.

Step 1: Use Enable Schedule command to activate the schedule.
Step 2: Use Set Flow Rate command with parameter 15.0 L/min to set the water flow.

Result: Execute ES and SFR(15.0) commands to enable the schedule and set the flow rate to 15 liters per minute.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Outdoor Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Status [RS]
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]
    Report Schedule [RSC]

USER QUERY:
Is the sprinkler currently on and what is the water flow rate?

The device properties include Status (On or Off) and Water Flow Rate (0.0 to 20.0 L/min). To find out the current state, the device supports send commands Report Status (RS) and Report Flow Rate (RFR).

Step 1: Send RS command to check if the sprinkler is on.
Step 2: Send RFR command to get the current water flow rate.

Result: By executing RS and RFR, you will know if the sprinkler is on and its current flow rate.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving Up [1]
        Moving Down [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt Angle [STA]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Stop Movement [SM]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RP]
    Report Tilt Angle [RTA]
    Report Status [RS]

USER QUERY:
Please open the window blinds halfway and tilt the slats to 30 degrees.

The window blind device has properties Position (0 to 100%), Tilt Angle (-90 to 90 degrees), and Status (Stopped, Moving Up, Moving Down). The user wants to set position to 50% (halfway open) and tilt angle to 30 degrees.

Step 1: Use Set Position command with parameter 50% to open the blinds halfway.
Step 2: Use Set Tilt Angle command with parameter 30 degrees to adjust the slats.

Result: Execute SP(50) and STA(30) commands to open the blinds halfway and tilt the slats to 30 degrees.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving Up [1]
        Moving Down [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt Angle [STA]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Stop Movement [SM]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RP]
    Report Tilt Angle [RTA]
    Report Status [RS]

USER QUERY:
Are the blinds currently moving, and what is their position?

The device properties include Status (Stopped, Moving Up, Moving Down) and Position (0 to 100%). To determine if the blinds are moving and their position, the device supports send commands Report Status (RS) and Report Position (RP).

Step 1: Send RS command to check if the blinds are moving or stopped.
Step 2: Send RP command to get the current position percentage.

Result: By executing RS and RP, you will know if the blinds are moving and their current position.
